ABSTRACT.P: is a light implementation of the MPI standard. This simple, straightforward proof-of-concept implementation is a subset of the MPI API, that allows MPI applications to benefit from the NewMadeleine communication engine. is based on the point-to-point nonblocking posting (isend, irecv) and completion (wait, test) operations of MPI, these four operations being directly mapped to the equivalent operations of NewMadeleine.

also implements some optimizations mechanisms for derived datatypes. MPI derived datatypes deal with noncontiguous memory locations. The advanced optimizations of NewMadeleine allowing to reorder packets lead to a significant gain when sending and receiving data based on derived datatypes.
